Customization

Distinguish yourself without starting from scratch.

Apply your own color, typography, spacing, and sizing to our prebuilt templates and components. There are two fundamentally different ways to customize the NYC Core Framework—with our CDN stylesheet and CSS custom properties, or with a Sass development environment.

CDN and Custom Properties

Our Quick Start Guide shows you how to include the Framework's core stylesheet via CDN. In the Framework, many of our style values are declared using custom properties (also known as CSS variables).

If you're unfamiliar with custom properties, read the MDN web docs. They are similar to Sass variables because they both allow you to store and reuse values in your CSS (see Figure 6 and 7 below). Custom properties, however, provide additional benefits that Sass variables do not.

Because custom properties can update at runtime, we can modify values from our CDN stylesheet by declaring new values in a second stylesheet. In the next exercise, you'll learn how to customize your theme colors using this methodology.

Customizing Colors

Copy and paste the following HTML into a new document. Save it as theming-example.html into your project's root directory.

Preview it in a browser. It should resemble the following.

These four colors (primary, secondary, dark, and light) are declared as custom properties within our core stylesheet which is loaded via CDN. Let's replace these values in a second stylesheet referenced just below the core stylesheet.

Within your project, create a new CSS file and name it theme-properties.css and save it to the /css/lib/ directory.

Next, open your HTML document and add a link to theme-properties.css below nyc_core.css.

With theme-properties.css open, include the following css, save this file, and refresh your browser.

Did your colors update to the blue palette? With our new stylesheet in place, we have the ability to change more than just colors. Next, we'll update our theme's base font family.

Customizing Fonts

Reopen theming-example.html, and add (or replace) the following content within the main tag.

You should see the following text in your browser.

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Cupiditate eaque repellat praesentium expedita nobis quas, beatae voluptatibus minus aperiam assumenda.

You can see just how easy it is to customize the NYC Core Framework using a second stylesheet. The table below provides a bird's eye-view of the custom properties we can change with our theme-properties.css stylesheet.

Custom Property Laundry List

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Sit sapiente ducimus sequi dicta molestiae.

Custom Property Default Value Copy to Clipboard
--primary #25caa4
--secondary #6500d6
--dark #262345
--light #f1f4f6
--text-on-primary var(--dark)
--text-on-secondary white
--a11y-link-color blue
--confirm #008230
--attention #3953B1
--warn #dc3545
Custom Property Default Value Copy to Clipboard
--base-font-weight-normal "Source Sans Pro"
--base-font-weight-normal 400
--base-font-weight-bold 700
--base-font-size 20px
--base-line-height: 1.45
--font-size-sm calc( var(--base-font-size) * 0.7 )
--font-size-md calc( var(--base-font-size) * 0.8 )
--font-size-rg: calc( var(--base-font-size) * 1 )
--font-size-xl calc( var(--base-font-size) * 1.4 )
--banner-headline-font-size calc( var(--base-font-size) * 3.8 )
--h1-font-size calc( var(--base-font-size) * 3 )
--h2-font-size calc( var(--base-font-size) * 2.2 )
--h3-font-size calc( var(--base-font-size) * 1.8 )
--h4-font-size calc( var(--base-font-size) * 1.6 )
--h5-font-size calc( var(--base-font-size) * 1.4 )
--h6-font-size calc( var(--base-font-size) * 1.1 )
--h6-font-size calc( var(--base-font-size) * 1.1 )
Custom Property Default Value Copy to Clipboard
--btn-padding-x 1em
--btn-padding-y 0.5em
--btn--icon-only-size 2em
